greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 = n in positive integers.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
formula: G.f.: ((theta_3(q) - 1)/2)^4, where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 08 2018
mathematica: r[n_] := Reduce[ w > 0 && x > 0 && y > 0 && z > 0 && w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 == n, {w, x, y, z}, Integers]; a[n_] := Which[rn = r[n]; rn === False, 0, Head[rn] === Or, Length[rn], True, 1]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 72}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 22 2013 *)
program: (PARI) seq(n)=Vec((sum(k=1, sqrtint(n), x^(k^2)) + O(x*x^n))^4 + O(x*x^n), -(n+1)) \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 08 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 23 2001
